description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match the original facing materials of the existing buildings in type, colour, dimensions and in the case of brickwork, bond, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development Order 1995 (or any other Order revoking or re-enacting this Order with or without modification) no windows or other openings shall be formed in the south-east elevation of the extension without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden, sitting out area or for any other purpose of a similar nature without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The design of the proposed rear extension is considered acceptable and would not be detrimental either in terms of the character or appearance of the property or neighbour amenity. 
The proposal accords with the policies contained in The London Plan (February 2004) and the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan (October 2003) so far as material to the proposals which are the subject of this approval. The policies listed below were relevant in the determination of this proposal:
Merton Unitary Development Plan (2003).
BE.15  New Buildings & Extensions, Daylight Sunlight Privacy and Visual Intrusion
BE.23  Alterations and Extensions to Buildings
